alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 11:02AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Little River, Sevier, Howard and southern McCurtain Counties through 1130 AM CDT... At 1101 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Grannis to 10 miles east of Broken Bow to 8 miles east of Raymond Gary State Park. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... De Queen, Nashville, Mineral Springs, Dierks, Horatio, Foreman, Idabel, Broken Bow, Lockesburg, Wilton, Tollette, Winthrop, Gillham, Ben Lomond, Corinth, Arkinda, Center Point, Oak Grove, Millerton and Haworth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
